phenoptr in ten hundred words

Kent Johnson

2017-08-09

phenoptr helps with inForm numbers and pictures

phenoptr makes it easier to read and use number tables and pictures made by PerkinElmer’s inForm® computer worker. phenoptr is part of the PerkinElmer Phenoptics™ family of Quantitative Pathology Research Solutions. For more facts visit the Phenoptics™ Phenoptics™ home place.

How to get it

Get phenoptr from GitHub:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("PerkinElmer/phenoptr", build_vignettes=TRUE)

How to use it

phenoptr works well with many parts of the tidyverse.

  • readr is used to read number tables.
  • tibbles (also known as data_frame) are used to hold number tables.
  • dplyr, purrr and this funny thing (%>%) are used a lot to help show you how to do things.

If you’d like to learn how to use the tidyverse, a good place to start is Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham’s free book R for data science.

What this can do

Read and clean up inForm number tables and pictures

list_cell_seg_files finds all inForm cell number tables from one place on your computer.

read_cell_seg_data reads inForm cell number tables and makes them easier to use in R.

read_components and read_maps read inForm pictures.

Find and draw position relationships between cells

find_nearest_distance finds how far each cell is to the nearest cell of each kind.

count_within finds the number of cells that are not too far from cells of another kind. count_within_batch does this for lots of kinds of cells from lots of pictures.

spatial_distribution_report makes a paper showing nearest friend relationships between cells of two kinds.

count_touching_cells looks at the form of cells to find, number, and make pictures of touching cells in paired groups.

Helpers

distance_matrix makes number tables showing how far cells are from each other.

subset_distance_matrix helps when you just want to use some of the cells.

select_rows picks cells in cell number tables that have the kind and numbers you are interested in.

Full documentation

For more words see the Tutorials and Reference parts of
all the words.

For more words showing how to use it and more number tables and pictures to try out, go to the phenoptrExamples place.

What is this?

This place is just for fun. It was made using only the ten hundred most used words (and some names). It was made with help from upgoer5. The idea is from XKCD.
